div.p: To NN, prefect of Egypt, from Aurelius Dionysius, also known as Pausanias, ward of [NN -]usanus, also known as Artemidorus son of Didymus, from the city of the Oxyrhynchites. [I ask, lord, that you grant me] possession of the property of Aurelia As[k]latarion, also known as Athen- [daughter of NN and NN] also known as Sinthonis of Antinoe, my mother who has died intestate, [according to the part of the edict whereby] you promise to grant (it) to legitimate heirs. Given on [(date)]. Translation: R. Ast, ZPE 190 (2014) 232
